text: The King of Saudi Arabia is the head of state and head of government of Saudi Arabia. He serves as the head of the Saudi monarchy -- House of Saud. The King is called the Custodian of the Two Holy Mosques (). The title, means Saudi Arabia's jurisdiction over the mosques of Masjid al Haram in Mecca and Masjid al-Nabawi in Medina, replaced His Majesty () in 1986. Their royal palace is the King’s Palace in Riyadh. Since 23 January 2015, the current king of Saudi Arabia is King Salman. ==Kings of Saudi Arabia (present)== This is a list of rulers of Saudi Arabia, a kingdom on the Arabian Peninsula. ===Sheikhdom of Diriyah=== * 1446–1727 Sheikhdom of Diriyah ===First Saudi State=== * 1727-1818 Emirate of Diriyah ===Second Saudi State=== * 1823-1891 Emirate of Nejd ===Third Saudi State (1902–present)=== *1902 - 1913: Emirate of Riyadh *1913 - 1921: Emirate of Nejd and Hasa *1921 - 1926: Sultanate of Nejd *1926 - 1932: Kingdom of Hejaz and Nejd *1932–present: Kingdom of Saudi Arabia ==References== List of rulers of Saudi Arabia *
title: King of Saudi Arabia
